Grouped_Utterances: I still feel guilty about not being a better father.
I keep thinking about times I wasn’t there for my kids when they needed me.
It felt good to finally get them done. I was nervous, but I did it. Not yet, but I’m trying to stay positive. I helped my daughter with her school project last week.
It felt calming. I could feel the tension easing.
A little. I still wake up, but I feel more relaxed before bed.
It’s been alright. I managed to apply for three jobs like we talked about. I’ve been trying to stick to it. I put my phone away, and I started reading instead.

Perhaps we could add a gratitude practice. Before bed, you could take a moment to write down three things you’re grateful for that day.  Great! Let’s start with a simple mindfulness exercise. I’ll guide you through it. Find a comfortable position, close your eyes, and take a deep breath in through your nose... and out through your mouth. As you breathe, focus on the sensation of the air filling your lungs. Notice how your body feels. If your mind wanders, gently bring it back to your breath. Let’s do this for a couple of minutes. Just breathe and be present. That’s wonderful! Mindfulness can be a powerful tool for managing anxiety. Would you like to practice this technique daily? Maybe I can write them down in a journal.
Perfect! Let’s set a goal for you to practice mindfulness for just five minutes each day this week.
